meanings.sent1: The loud music did disple my neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The long wait at the doctor's office did disple the patients.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to eat the new food did disple its owner.
meanings.sent4: The constant dripping of the leaky faucet did disple her like a never-ending drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag on the shirt did disple him to the point of frustration.

meanings.sent1: I began to disple at the lack of progress in the project.
meanings.sent2: She would often disple when her favorite show was interrupted.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to disple at having to wear the silly costume.
meanings.sent4: His heart would disple like a stormy sea whenever he thought of the accident.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine did disple her taste buds with its bitterness.
